channel.title: Client Auto Updater
channel.description: Wondering if anyone had a tutorial or just some lead way on how to create one?

item.title: Client Auto Updater
item.dc:creator: @xx_c1ph3r_xx xx c1ph3r xx
item.description:
@xx_c1ph3r_xx wrote:

add md5 class to client that calculates each file in their client folder’s md5 checksum, then during loading have ur client connect to ur server like www.mywebsite.php/remotechecksum.php?filename={CURRENT FILE CHECKING}

and have ur latest client files stored in the same directory as remotechecksum

the php file just needs

<?php
echo md5_file($_GET['filename']);
?>

so it outputs the checksum of the newest file
have java read the line on the page, if it doesnt match the one locally stored
have client download one from server and overwrite

right there you stopped people from modifying and running and clients always are up to date automatically

Read full topic

I’m pretty sure you just add “auto-update client” into the batch file and it should run automatically. The class file just has gibberish, not sure what the point of it is.

item.title: Client Auto Updater
item.dc:creator: @uberpk3r uberpk3r
item.description:
@uberpk3r wrote:

[quote=“Ecko, post:6, topic:381737”][quote author=uberpk3r link=topic=477547.msg3494116#msg3494116 date=1297165216]

Wondering if anyone had a tutorial or just some lead way on how to create one?

Have client check a PHP script for latest version number. If it’s different, begin downloading new client/files/whatever needs updating.

I’m sure there’s quite a few clients that already a base.

Wow, what happen to you ? you are so friendly, are you high sir?
[/quote]
Wow, what hasn’t happened to you? Are you still suffering from brain damage?[/quote]

GET OUT OF MY BRAIN!

Read full topic
